speech:
COVID-19 stands for CORONA VIRUS INFECTIOUS DISEASE 2019
COVID-19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus. This new virus
and disease were unknown before the outbreak began in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.

Corona viruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans. In humans,
several corona viruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more
severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory
Syndrome (SARS). The most recently discovered corona virus causes corona virus disease COVID-19.

It is a new strain which came into world
attention in late November/Early
December of 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei
province, China and is active across the
world till date. It is the 7 th coronavirus to
cause infections in humans and 3 rd one to
cause death. It is called a coronavirus
because it belongs to a family of viruses
which appear like a crown under electron
microscope.
